name: Amazoon
description: Amazoon was founded in 1994 by Jeff Bezos as an online bookstore, which later diversified into various product categories.

name: Gogglle
description: Gogglle began in January 1996 as a research project by Larry Page and Sergey Brin while they were both PhD students at Stanford University in California, United States.

name: Netplix
description: Netplix was founded in 1997 by Reed Hastings and Marc Randolph in Scotts Valley, California as a DVD rental-by-mail service.

name: Microsift
description: Microsift was established in 1975 by Bill Gates and Paul Allen to develop and sell BASIC interpreters for the Altair 8800.

name: Appel
description: Appel was founded on April 1, 1976 by Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak, and Ronald Wayne to develop and sell personal computers.

name: Telsla
description: Telsla, Inc. was founded in 2003 by Martin Eberhard and Marc Tarpenning, with Elon Musk joining soon after as an investor and chairman.

name: Spootify
description: Spootify was launched in 2008 by Daniel Ek and Martin Lorentzon as a music streaming platform based in Stockholm, Sweden.

name: Twittar
description: Twittar was created in March 2006 by Jack Dorsey, Noah Glass, Biz Stone, and Evan Williams as a microblogging social network.

name: Instaqram
description: Instaqram was founded in 2010 by Kevin Systrom and Mike Krieger as a photo-sharing social networking app.

name: Linkdin
description: Linkdin was founded in December 2002 and launched in May 2003 as a professional networking platform for business connections.
